summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from May 3, 2023, summarizing news articles of interest to the FBI. It includes a section on criminal investigations where victims of Jeffrey Epstein demand a federal investigation into the FBI's past failure to probe sex trafficking allegations against him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a news article summary where his victims are demanding a federal investigation into the FBI's past failure to probe sex trafficking allegations against him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as someone who abused a victim, according to legal counsel cited in a news summary.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.role: Special Counsel to Marsh Law, legal counsel for Epstein victims
persons.context: Quoted in a news summary, stating her client reported abuse by Epstein and Maxwell to the FBI in 1996 and criticizing the FBI's subsequent inaction.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news summaries, including one where he is criticized by Senator Josh Hawley and another where he comments on the Hunter Biden probe.

persons.name: Josh Hawley
persons.context: Quoted criticizing Attorney General Merrick Garland and the DOJ in a news summary about attacks on pregnancy centers.

connections.description: Described together as abusers of a victim who reported to the FBI in 1996, according to legal counsel Jennifer Freeman.
Freeman is legal counsel for several of Epstein's sex trafficking survivors and is demanding an investigation into the FBI's failure to act on allegations against him.

events.title: Victim Report to FBI on Epstein
events.description: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell reported the abuse to the FBI, providing detailed allegations about Epstein's involvement with sexually exploitative images of children.

events.title: Epstein Victims Demand FBI Investigation
events.description: Legal counsel for several of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking survivors sent a letter to the FBI, DOJ, and AG demanding a full investigation into the FBI's repeated failures to properly investigate Epstein's sex trafficking.

keyFacts: Victims of Jeffrey Epstein are demanding a federal investigation into the FBI's failure to probe sex trafficking allegations that date back decades.
Legal counsel Jennifer Freeman states a client reported Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's abuse to the FBI in August 1996, detailing Epstein's involvement with exploitative images of children.
The letter from victims' counsel calls for an investigation into the FBI's failure to act on "repeated red flags" about Epstein's sex trafficking and possible child sex abuse material crimes.
The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing, showing the bureau internally circulating news about criticism of its own handling of the Epstein case.
The briefing includes numerous other news summaries unrelated to Epstein, covering topics like mass shootings, border security, and other criminal investigations.
